meanings.definition: The act of soliciting a ride from passing vehicles by standing on the side of the road.
meanings.sent1: Hitchhiking can be a fun way to meet new people while traveling.
meanings.sent2: I tried hitchhiking to get to the next town when my car broke down.
meanings.sent3: The hitchhiking adventure turned into a race against time to reach the destination.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like hitchhiking, with unexpected twists and turns along the way.
meanings.sent5: The concept of hitchhiking became a symbol of freedom and spontaneity in his mind.

meanings.definition: To travel by soliciting rides from passing vehicles.
meanings.sent1: We decided to hitchhike to the concert to save money on transportation.
meanings.sent2: She hitchhiked across the country and had many interesting experiences.
meanings.sent3: Hitchhiking through the city felt like being in a real-life adventure movie.
meanings.sent4: His career seemed to hitchhike from one success to another without a clear plan.
meanings.sent5: The idea to hitchhike to the beach sparked excitement among the group of friends.
